info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 11:52AM EDT until June 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
Wildcat Creek near Jerome to Lafayette.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Ravenswood.
.Rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches across portions of central Indiana late Friday into early Saturday continues to produce minor flooding along area creeks and rivers. Flooding along Wildcat Creek and Wabash River will gradually diminish over the next 24-48 hours. Flooding along the White River at Ravenswood will end by Sunday night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Ravenswood.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.by
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Lowest portion of Ravenswood begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 1215 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
